intro: Gonolobus chiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces violet to blue flowers that open in the early morning, giving it its common name. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and twining. Gonolobus chiriquensis is typically found in moist, shaded areas in tropical forests.
